name: ack-import-guard
description: Enforces .js extensions on all relative imports in TypeScript files, required for ESM compatibility in ACK.

hooks.command: bash -c 'INPUT=$(cat); FILE=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r ".file_path // empty"); if [[ "$FILE" == *.ts || "$FILE" == *.tsx ]] && [[ "$FILE" != *.d.ts ]]; then CONTENT=$(echo "$INPUT" | jq -r ".content // .new_string // empty"); BAD=$(echo "$CONTENT" | grep -nE "^(import|export).*from [\x27\"]\.\.?/[^\x27\"]+[^.][^j][^s][\x27\"]" 2>/dev/null | grep -v "\.js" | head -5); if [[ -n "$BAD" ]]; then echo "BLOCK: Relative imports must use .js extension (ESM requirement):" >&2; echo "$BAD" >&2; exit 1; fi; fi'
